summary: yo what’s up just rewatching nott’s backstory reveal and she actually says that she and yeza came to roughly that spot on the...
body: yo what’s up just rewatching nott’s backstory reveal and she actually says that she and yeza came to roughly that spot on the riverside to spend time together so not only did the goblins torture her and her family and turn her into what she believes to be the physical manifestation of all her worst traits and enslave her for a year, they tainted probably one of the only spots in felderwin that holds good (treasured, even) memories for nott and ruined her ability to ever enjoy herself there ever again

blog.name: fisherrend
blog.title: DnD Creations
blog.description: Self-taught creative mind from Sweden. There is nothing I love more than to draw, write and make shit up. Here you will find maps, characters, races, monsters, original characters, fan characters and other bits and pieces made, drawn or written by me. All homebrew content is available for public use; just don't claim it as your own. Please do share though if you use anything I've made, I'd love to showcase your creations!

summary: There was a lot of accidental foreshadowing in ep 50 “How long have you lived down here?” “Eleven days!” “How long do Kobolds...
body:
There was a lot of accidental foreshadowing in ep 50

“How long have you lived down here?”
“Eleven days!”
“How long do Kobolds live?”
“Eleven days!!”
Well he wasn’t wrong..

“Do you want to go with us towards the light at the end of the tunnel?”
I’d say he reached it. 

“Do you need me to do anything to make the diversion look even more realistic?”
“I don’t think so.”
Could’ve used that extra authenticity, Fjord.

“If I go out there and trip.. The jig is up.”
“Are you gonna trip?”
She tripped.

tags: i'm never sure quite how i should link to my ao3 fic but this will do for now
summary: People - timbrene - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: People - timbrene - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
It’s quiet in the tunnels. The light of their small campfire flickers at the edge of their little circle, where Caduceus sits alone with an array of pots and bowls and jars. In the corner, nearest the fire, Caleb pulls the blankets tighter around him.

He ought not to be alone with his thoughts - not now. But there is no avoiding them in the endless dark, not when Jester and Beauregard have drifted off already, and the others on their way. Better here, he supposes, than in an inn somewhere. At least here, he is not alone with Nott. Here, he can face away from the others and pretend not to notice the gulf of space and other bodies between the two of them on the ground.

His people. Bren’s people. He cannot hide behind another picture of himself any longer. Not when his past claws its way out to hurt the ones he cares for. For all he knows, Nott’s husband is dead. For all he’s seen, Caleb halfway hopes that he is. And though his old compatriots may not have been the ones to take him, they were most certainly involved. The ones to get him into this mess, in the first place. If he had done something sooner, would this be different?

It doesn’t matter. He has not done a thing. Has run away at every turn, and let the Empire and its dogs lay the cards out where they wished as he hid instead of keeping these people safe. This is as much his fault as it is anyone else’s. His people were his responsibility, and he has ignored them too long. He should know better. He does know better. Stupid.

“Mr. Caleb?” says a quiet voice from a few feet away.

His head snaps to the side. He swallows the first response that leaps to mind.

“Ja, what?”

Almost excruciatingly slowly, Caduceus looks from him back down to the stew. He draws the ladle out and gives it a sniff.

“Are you busy?”

Almost excruciatingly slowly, Caduceus looks from him back down to the stew. He draws the ladle out and gives it a sniff.

summary: Througout most of campaign 1, Percy was the only one who couldn’t see in the dark, so had to rely on all the others to guide him...
body:
Througout most of campaign 1, Percy was the only one who couldn’t see in the dark, so had to rely on all the others to guide him around in dark places. Now in campaign 2 Beau has her dark vision goggles and Caleb has Frumpkin’s various forms that have dark vision and/or his transmuters stone, and so Caduceus is the only one in the party without any form of darkvision

Hypothesis: Taliesin is just doomed to play That One Dude who can’t see in the dark. For reasons too complicated to be understood by humans, the universe will not allow anything else
